intro: Riedelia tenuifolia, commonly known as the slenderleaf riedelia, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and spikes of tubular, violet-blue flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal areas, thriving in well-drained soils. It is often found in Mediterranean climates and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
